alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 3:40PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding due to excessive rainfall remains likely. * WHERE...Interstate 40 and Route 66 between Ash Fork and Seligman. Portions of north central Arizona and west central Arizona, including parts of Coconino and Yavapai counties. * WHEN...Until 430 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 327 PM MST, rainfall was still occurring in the vicinity of the advised area. Further significant rainfall is not expected, but minor flood impacts are expected to continue. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Pine Creek, Ash Fork Draw, Meath Wash, Eightmile Creek, Pineveta Wash, Walnut Creek, Partridge Creek and Big Chino Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Coconino and Yavapai Counties, west and southwest of Ash Fork - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 134 and 144. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
